Container.name: Baker_conversation

Key.Original: Yes, I suppose so. Anything I can help you with, Sergeant?
Key.English: Yes, I suppose so. Anything I can help you with, Sergeant?

Key.Original: I don't think so, Sergeant Frost.
Key.English: I don't think so, Sergeant Frost.

Key.Original: Ok, Brian, and will there be anything else?
Key.English: Ok, Brian, and will there be anything else?

Key.Original: Doctor Baker? The Doctor Baker?
Key.English: Doctor Baker? The Doctor Baker?

Key.Original: Sergeant Frost, Parachute Regiment. Say I wanted to skive off an assignment, could we both pretend I have a, uh... trench foot?
Key.English: Sergeant Frost, Parachute Regiment. Say I wanted to skive off an assignment, could we both pretend I have a, uh... trench foot?

Key.Original: Please, call me Brian.
Key.English: Please, call me Brian.

Container.name: Baker_topic1
Container.situation: in fob arizona, baker in mash (player initiates topic)

Key.Original: Oh no, there are two Czech doctors in Falar, uh, with some funny European names...
Key.English: Oh no, there are two Czech doctors in Falar, uh, with some funny European names...

Key.Original: ...and a refugee help center in Feruz Abad. We try to do our best.
Key.English: ...and a refugee help center in Feruz Abad. We try to do our best.

Key.Original: So, are you the only NGO worker here?
Key.English: So, are you the only NGO worker here?

Key.Original: Budweiser and Pilsner?
Key.English: Budweiser and Pilsner?

Key.Original: I see. I appreciate the info.
Key.English: I see. I appreciate the info.

Key.Original: Civilian workers
Key.English: Civilian workers

Container.situation: in fob arizona, baker in mash (player initiates topic)

Key.Original: Oh, yes. There was an insurgent raid on my place in Zargabad only few weeks ago.
Key.English: Oh, yes. There was an insurgent raid on my place in Zargabad only few weeks ago.

Key.Original: So now I work for the people of Rasman, and the base personnel.
Key.English: So now I work for the people of Rasman, and the base personnel.

Key.Original: So, do you stay here?
Key.English: So, do you stay here?

Key.English: FOB Arizona

Container.situation: in fob arizona, baker in mash (player initiates topic)

Key.Original: Sergeant, I'd rather not talk about that.
Key.English: Sergeant, I'd rather not talk about that.

Key.Original: No problem, Brian. Just avoid falling into their hands - they are ruthless and desperate.
Key.English: No problem, Brian. Just avoid falling into their hands - they are ruthless and desperate.

Key.Original: May I ask you... You were captured by Takistani special forces, right?
Key.English: May I ask you... You were captured by Takistani special forces, right?

Key.Original: I beg your pardon, doctor. I didn't mean to...
Key.English: I beg your pardon, doctor. I didn't mean to...

Key.English: Arrowhead

Container.name: CO_conversation
Container.situation: arriving base, new co sent a section for them, formal speaking in the beginning

Key.Original: Sergeant. I'm very glad you've made it here.
Key.English: Sergeant. I'm very glad you've made it here.

Key.Original: Calm down, Frosty. Com's about to explode, ADOC is under scrutiny, all hell's let loose.
Key.English: Calm down, Frosty. Com's about to explode, ADOC is under scrutiny, all hell's let loose.

Key.Original: It might be an IFF transponder malfunction, we just don't know at this stage. We need to give them time to investigate.
Key.English: It might be an IFF transponder malfunction, we just don't know at this stage. We need to give them time to investigate.

Key.Original: Someone gravely misjudged the situation and, let me assure you, heads will roll.
Key.English: Someone gravely misjudged the situation and, let me assure you, heads will roll.

Key.Original: Just leave it to me, Sergeant.
Key.English: Just leave it to me, Sergeant.

Key.Original: We're in a war, Sergeant. Accidents happen, you'd do well to accept that.
Key.English: We're in a war, Sergeant. Accidents happen, you'd do well to accept that.

Key.Original: Now, to the op. Chief Fobbit will take care of your section.
Key.English: Now, to the op. Chief Fobbit will take care of your section.

Key.Original: A Paramedic and sapper were assigned to your section, Sergeants Irvine and Stephenson - both fine lads.
Key.English: A Paramedic and sapper were assigned to your section, Sergeants Irvine and Stephenson - both fine lads.

Key.Original: Meet, greet, and get some rest. See you at the platoon briefing at 21:00. Dismissed.
Key.English: Meet, greet, and get some rest. See you at the platoon briefing at 21:00. Dismissed.

Key.Original: Oh, by the by, you may be interested in speaking to Dr. Baker too, she knows this place.
Key.English: Oh, by the by, you may be interested in speaking to Dr. Baker too, she knows this place.

Key.Original: Lieutenant, Sgt. Frost reporting in, sir.
Key.English: Lieutenant, Sgt. Frost reporting in, sir.

Key.Original: Sir, I need an explanation on that attack. What the hell happened?
Key.English: Sir, I need an explanation on that attack. What the hell happened?

Key.Original: What am I supposed to tell my men?
Key.English: What am I supposed to tell my men?

Key.Original: Yes, sir.
Key.English: Yes, sir.

Key.Original: Thanks.
Key.English: Thanks.

Container.name: Crash_landing
Container.situation: after emergency landing in enemy territory (ground)

Key.Original: Warhorse-2-0 to Lancer Red, we're your CAS. Keep your heads down; your ride will be here ASAP. Out.
Key.English: Warhorse-2-0 to Lancer Red, we're your CAS. Keep your heads down; your ride will be here ASAP. Out.

Key.Original: Warmonger, this is Lancer Red, Sgt. Frost speaking. Zero casualties, but the chopper's had it. Please advise, over.
Key.English: Warmonger, this is Lancer Red, Sgt. Frost speaking. Zero casualties, but the chopper's had it. Please advise, over.

Key.Original: Okay, boys, clear the area and stay sharp, we may have contact. Pilots, hold back.
Key.English: Okay, boys, clear the area and stay sharp, we may have contact. Pilots, hold back.

Key.Original: I won't tell you again, Gallagher: Keep your eyes open and your trap shut.
Key.English: I won't tell you again, Gallagher: Keep your eyes open and your trap shut.

Key.Original: Looks like these hills have got more than just eyes, Sarge.
Key.English: Looks like these hills have got more than just eyes, Sarge.

Key.Original: Great, trigger-happy fly-boys, just what we needed.
Key.English: Great, trigger-happy fly-boys, just what we needed.

Key.Original: Copy that. Listen, Frost, rescue is inbound. You're to sit tight and secure the perimeter.
Key.English: Copy that. Listen, Frost, rescue is inbound. You're to sit tight and secure the perimeter.

Key.Original: We read movement west of your grid, possibly hostile. Warmonger out.
Key.English: We read movement west of your grid, possibly hostile. Warmonger out.

Key.English: Sgt. Stephenson? I'm Sgt. Frost, Lancer Red, you're supposed to join my section.

Key.Original: Name's Phil, nice to meet yeh. 'Bout time to kick some insurgent arse, right?
Key.English: Name's Phil, nice to meet yeh. 'Bout time to kick some insurgent arse, right?

Key.Original: Just a sec, lad, gotta finish this op. 'It the deck!
Key.English: Just a sec, lad, gotta finish this op. 'It the deck!

Key.Original: Heard you've been involved with some counter-IED ops?
Key.English: Heard you've been involved with some counter-IED ops?

Key.Original: True'nuff. It's mental: back to good ol' wires and timers - totally impossible to jam.
Key.English: True'nuff. It's mental: back to good ol' wires and timers - totally impossible to jam.

Key.Original: But we 'ave lowered the number of incidents of late; looks like this new COIN strategy's finally payin' off.
Key.English: But we 'ave lowered the number of incidents of late; looks like this new COIN strategy's finally payin' off.

Key.English: I've heard the insurgents are pretty active around here..?

Key.English: Pretty active? By 'eck, you gotta check for a maniac with Kalashnikov even on the latrine!

Key.English: We had a dozen or so ambushes, just in past three days. Bloody terrorist bastards.

Key.English: Keep a lid on it, Jack.

Key.English: Look, this isn't Oasis on tour, Gallagher, this is a warzone. Get your head together and pipe down.

Key.Original: Cheers for the ride, mate. Hope this was the last time, but we owe you one. Stay safe.
Key.English: Cheers for the ride, mate. Hope this was the last time, but we owe you one. Stay safe.

Key.Original: Howay man, you've gotta be shittin' is, I told you these Yanks were trigger happy, like.
Key.English: Howay man, you've gotta be shittin' is, I told you these Yanks were trigger happy, like.

Key.Original: Well, I'd sort of hoped for a warmer welcome, Sarge.
Key.English: Well, I'd sort of hoped for a warmer welcome, Sarge.

Key.Original: Welcome aboard, Lancer Red. Now that was a ruddy fine way to make an entrance.
Key.English: Welcome aboard, Lancer Red. Now that was a ruddy fine way to make an entrance.

Key.English: Uh, lads, just overheard the traffic... Sounds like you boys were struck by a friendly missile - a US anti-air team.

Key.Original: And we're home... Thank you for flying with British Armed Forces Aviation, Flight 1419. We wish you a pleasant stay...
Key.English: And we're home... Thank you for flying with British Armed Forces Aviation, Flight 1419. We wish you a pleasant stay...

Key.English: Shut it and bite down!

Key.English: Jesus, man! Where the fuck did that come from?

Key.English: What the - bloody hell - missile inbound, missile inbound! Brace for impact.

Container.name: Soliloquy
Container.situation: introductory soliloquy, sin city, apocalyspe now, max payne

Key.Original: The undulating landscape pulsated below our Wild Cat as we scudded over central Takistan.
Key.English: The undulating landscape pulsated below our Wild Cat as we scudded over central Takistan.

Key.Original: Those hills were a sullen, lifeless mass of rock and dirt; yet, they betrayed an ominous presence.
Key.English: Those hills were a sullen, lifeless mass of rock and dirt; yet, they betrayed an ominous presence.

Key.Original: My lads were fresh - boys in every sense of the word.
Key.English: My lads were fresh - boys in every sense of the word.

Key.Original: I felt a paternal connection with them - I had to keep them safe: safe from those bastards, safe from the hills, safe from themselves...
Key.English: I felt a paternal connection with them - I had to keep them safe: safe from those bastards, safe from the hills, safe from themselves...

Key.English: Heads up, lads, we're one minute out. Welcome to the mountains.

Key.English: Negative, Sergeant, these hills are safe as houses.

Key.English: The Yanks just dealt out a right good pounding 'round here.

Key.Original: Personal notes
Key.English: Personal notes

Key.Original: Report to CO
Key.English: Report to CO

Key.Original: REPORT
Key.English: REPORT

Key.Original:
19 July, very early morning:
We've got a few minutes between the morning brew and boarding, still at Camp Dragon in Karichar, waiting for the go. This op is supposed to be a major offensive on an insugent force holding the Sarman Ghar ridge, part of a joint build up of coalition forces across T-Stan. My lads saw just the plains around Karichar - an ugly but relatively safe place; the mountains are supposed to be dangerous as hell. We're to replace the boys from 3 PARA, tough as nails, but damn glad to leave those bloody hills.
Key.English:
19 July, very early morning:
We've got a few minutes between the morning brew and boarding, still at Camp Dragon in Karichar, waiting for the go. This op is supposed to be a major offensive on an insugent force holding the Sarman Ghar ridge, part of a joint build up of coalition forces across T-Stan. My lads saw just the plains around Karichar - an ugly but relatively safe place; the mountains are supposed to be dangerous as hell. We're to replace the boys from 3 PARA, tough as nails, but damn glad to leave those bloody hills.

Key.Original: Mission
Key.English: Mission

Key.Original:
- 1st Section/2/1Coy/2 PARA (callsign Lancer Red) will be transported by a helicopter (Foxtrot 5) from Karichar IA, inbound to FOB Arizona, Central Military Region, Takistan. Troops will be transferred with personal weapons and equipment aboard the helicopter; all combat zone flight rules apply.

- Upon landing, the section commander (Sgt. Brian Frost) will report to troop commander in TF Lion TOC.
Key.English:
- 1st Section/2/1Coy/2 PARA (callsign Lancer Red) will be transported by a helicopter (Foxtrot 5) from Karichar IA, inbound to FOB Arizona, Central Military Region, Takistan. Troops will be transferred with personal weapons and equipment aboard the helicopter; all combat zone flight rules apply.

- Upon landing, the section commander (Sgt. Brian Frost) will report to troop commander in TF Lion TOC.

Key.Original: Situation - Central Takistan
Key.English: Situation - Central Takistan

Key.Original:
- Aggresive insurgency activity in the area is rooted in a well organized core of the former Republican Militia. They are armed with light anti-armor and anti-air weapons, with a sporadic array of armored fighting vehicles and lightly armed trucks. Their chief objectives are to intimidate the local populace and establish territorial control over the area to facilitate a further build-up of support.

- Coalition forces in the region are stationed in FOB Arizona (joint UK-US contingent) and FOB Revolver (US contingent). The British presence at FOB Arizona is organized as Lion battle group, composed of elements of 2nd Parachute Regiment, and attached support units belonging to the 16th Air Assault Brigade. Task Force Tribal constitutes the US forces assigned to the op.

- UNFORT(United Nations Force Takistan) in the area is composed of a company-sized mechanized unit from the Chernarussian Defence Forces (CDF). According to their mandate, UN forces are responsible for the protection of the Takistani population, strategic resources and humanitarian aid workers in the region. Their assistance in combat operations is very limited. UNFORT is stationed at a base near Feruz Abad - Whitewolf - and at FOB Arizona.

- The local civilian populace, which left the contested areas affected by Operation Arrowhead, are slowly returning to their dwellings, provided with humanitarian assistance by numerous NGOs and protection by UNFORT.

- Due to insurgent activity in the area, NATO troops, UN observers and TPF personnel face many dangers: Improvised Explosive Devices (IEDs), minefields, ambushes, and kidnappings.
Key.English:
- Aggresive insurgency activity in the area is rooted in a well organized core of the former Republican Militia. They are armed with light anti-armor and anti-air weapons, with a sporadic array of armored fighting vehicles and lightly armed trucks. Their chief objectives are to intimidate the local populace and establish territorial control over the area to facilitate a further build-up of support.

- Coalition forces in the region are stationed in FOB Arizona (joint UK-US contingent) and FOB Revolver (US contingent). The British presence at FOB Arizona is organized as Lion battle group, composed of elements of 2nd Parachute Regiment, and attached support units belonging to the 16th Air Assault Brigade. Task Force Tribal constitutes the US forces assigned to the op.

- UNFORT(United Nations Force Takistan) in the area is composed of a company-sized mechanized unit from the Chernarussian Defence Forces (CDF). According to their mandate, UN forces are responsible for the protection of the Takistani population, strategic resources and humanitarian aid workers in the region. Their assistance in combat operations is very limited. UNFORT is stationed at a base near Feruz Abad - Whitewolf - and at FOB Arizona.

- The local civilian populace, which left the contested areas affected by Operation Arrowhead, are slowly returning to their dwellings, provided with humanitarian assistance by numerous NGOs and protection by UNFORT.

- Due to insurgent activity in the area, NATO troops, UN observers and TPF personnel face many dangers: Improvised Explosive Devices (IEDs), minefields, ambushes, and kidnappings.

Key.Original: Briefing
Key.English: Briefing

Key.Original:
- Despite the effort of both the NATO contingent and newly formed Takistani Police Forces, hardened followers of the old regime have mounted a powerful insurgency movement. The insurgent's power base is rooted in the central Takistan, where they pose a real threat to the oil and mining industries - vital assets for the redeveloment of this fledgling nation.

- On 20 July 2012, the Allied JOC plans to launch a major offensive upon conventional insurgent forces in Central Takistan, code-named: 'Crimson Lance'. The intent of the JOC is to strike deep into insurgent controlled area, disrupting safe havens and logistical connections, which presently undermine the industrial stabilization and humanitarian efforts in the area.

- Elements of 2 Parachute Batallion - including your section - will converge upon two major bases in the area: FOB Arizona and FOB Revolver. Immediately after landing, your section is to rest, replenish all supplies and prepare for combat operations, which will commence on the morning of July 20.
Key.English:
- Despite the effort of both the NATO contingent and newly formed Takistani Police Forces, hardened followers of the old regime have mounted a powerful insurgency movement. The insurgent's power base is rooted in the central Takistan, where they pose a real threat to the oil and mining industries - vital assets for the redeveloment of this fledgling nation.

- On 20 July 2012, the Allied JOC plans to launch a major offensive upon conventional insurgent forces in Central Takistan, code-named: 'Crimson Lance'. The intent of the JOC is to strike deep into insurgent controlled area, disrupting safe havens and logistical connections, which presently undermine the industrial stabilization and humanitarian efforts in the area.

- Elements of 2 Parachute Batallion - including your section - will converge upon two major bases in the area: FOB Arizona and FOB Revolver. Immediately after landing, your section is to rest, replenish all supplies and prepare for combat operations, which will commence on the morning of July 20.

Key.English: Jester to incoming troops, identify yourselves. You are entering a military area.

Key.Original: Alright, Frosty, is that you? Bloody hell, we've been waiting for you the whole morning. What's kept you?
Key.English: Alright, Frosty, is that you? Bloody hell, we've been waiting for you the whole morning. What's kept you?

Key.Original: Sounds like a busy morning. Welcome to FOB Jester: home of the forgotten.
Key.English: Sounds like a busy morning. Welcome to FOB Jester: home of the forgotten.

Key.Original: Sounds a bit like Hull. Get ready for anything, mate.
Key.English: Sounds a bit like Hull. Get ready for anything, mate.

Container.name: Distress_call
Container.situation: radio, sidequest, tanks in front of minefield (passing bastam)

Key.Original: Lancer Red, copy. Diverting now, over.
Key.English: Lancer Red, copy. Diverting now, over.

Key.Original: Lion to Lancer Red, we have a situation here.
Key.English: Lion to Lancer Red, we have a situation here.

Key.Original: Vector Green are trapped in a minefield and are taking fire - Bastam green zone.
Key.English: Vector Green are trapped in a minefield and are taking fire - Bastam green zone.

Key.Original: Get Stephenson over there and take care of it. High priority, how copy?
Key.English: Get Stephenson over there and take care of it. High priority, how copy?

Key.Original: Bloody terrorist bastards
Key.English: Bloody terrorist bastards

Container.name: Elder_pleased
Container.situation: calm (ensler's package delivered)

Key.Original: Mr Masood Rabbani?
Key.English: Mr Masood Rabbani?

Key.Original: Hello sir, I have a package for you. Here, please take this.
Key.English: Hello sir, I have a package for you. Here, please take this.

Key.Original: Thank you, sir, though, I hope we won't need to call on your services any time soon.
Key.English: Thank you, sir, though, I hope we won't need to call on your services any time soon.

Key.Original: Hello soldier. What you want in small cottage of me?
Key.English: Hello soldier. What you want in small cottage of me?

Key.Original: Thank you, Sergeant, we are grateful. These medicines are badly needed.
Key.English: Thank you, Sergeant, we are grateful. These medicines are badly needed.

Key.Original: The tribe of Jilavur is in debt, we can assist in defending your base. I think you will soon need every hand you can muster.
Key.English: The tribe of Jilavur is in debt, we can assist in defending your base. I think you will soon need every hand you can muster.

Container.name: End
Container.situation: calm, after mission (reported in fob)

Key.Original: Lancer Red to Lion, reporting in. We've just arrived at FOB Jester. Over.
Key.English: Lancer Red to Lion, reporting in. We've just arrived at FOB Jester. Over.

Key.Original: Bollocks. Not today...
Key.English: Bollocks. Not today...

Key.Original: Divert reinforcements? Jesus Christ, man...
Key.English: Divert reinforcements? Jesus Christ, man...

Key.Original: Copy that, Lion. We'll prep for defence and counter with a textbook reponse.
Key.English: Copy that, Lion. We'll prep for defence and counter with a textbook reponse.

Key.Original: Just get your finger out with those reinforcements, alright? Lancer Red out.
Key.English: Just get your finger out with those reinforcements, alright? Lancer Red out.

Key.Original: Roger that, Lancer Red, glad to have you there.
Key.English: Roger that, Lancer Red, glad to have you there.

Key.Original: Now listen: we need you and Jester to prepare to fight...
Key.English: Now listen: we need you and Jester to prepare to fight...

Key.Original: There are several armed groups - partly motorized, probably hostile - converging upon your location from the west and north.
Key.English: There are several armed groups - partly motorized, probably hostile - converging upon your location from the west and north.

Key.Original: We need you to hold the ground. We're seeking to divert reinforcements now. Over.
Key.English: We need you to hold the ground. We're seeking to divert reinforcements now. Over.

Container.name: Ensler_task
Container.situation: threatened by takistani insurgents (met ensler)

Key.Original: Much obliged, yes, it's right on our route to the base.
Key.English: Much obliged, yes, it's right on our route to the base.

Key.Original: Good. Take this package and deliver it to commander Masood Rabbani in Jilavur. His men can help you.
Key.English: Good. Take this package and deliver it to commander Masood Rabbani in Jilavur. His men can help you.

Key.Original: It's the medicine they need. Don't lose it, Sergeant.
Key.English: It's the medicine they need. Don't lose it, Sergeant.

Key.Original: Sorry, madam, our itinerary is a military secret, but we...
Key.English: Sorry, madam, our itinerary is a military secret, but we...

Key.Original: Guess I can't really help then. Goodbye, Sergeant.
Key.English: Guess I can't really help then. Goodbye, Sergeant.

Key.Original: Rita Ensler? Nice to meet you. Dr. Hladik speaks highly of you.
Key.English: Rita Ensler? Nice to meet you. Dr. Hladik speaks highly of you.

Key.Original: Another rough lad looking for an intel, right?
Key.English: Another rough lad looking for an intel, right?

Key.Original: Well, I may have something, should you happen to go to Jilavur?
Key.English: Well, I may have something, should you happen to go to Jilavur?

Container.name: Hladik_done
Container.situation: thankful for getting supplies (medicine brought back)

Key.Original: Pleasure to help you, doctor.
Key.English: Pleasure to help you, doctor.

Key.Original: That's great, Doctor, cheers.
Key.English: That's great, Doctor, cheers.

Key.Original: Ahh, you found it! Thanks a lot, Sergeant.
Key.English: Ahh, you found it! Thanks a lot, Sergeant.

Key.Original: Listen, Dr. Hrabec, my colleague, he is now with the local warlord and his guerilla hunters.
Key.English: Listen, Dr. Hrabec, my colleague, he is now with the local warlord and his guerilla hunters.

Key.Original: I will give him a call, he may negotiate some help.
Key.English: I will give him a call, he may negotiate some help.

Key.Original: Oh, check also with Rita Ensler, she's running the Refugee Help Center in Feruz Abad. She may have something useful.
Key.English: Oh, check also with Rita Ensler, she's running the Refugee Help Center in Feruz Abad. She may have something useful.

Container.name: Hladik_intro
Container.situation: thankful for disarming ied (meet hladik)

Key.Original: Let's hear it.
Key.English: Let's hear it.

Key.Original: We'll do our very best, Doctor.
Key.English: We'll do our very best, Doctor.

Key.Original: Great! Well, they headed into the hills east of here.
Key.English: Great! Well, they headed into the hills east of here.

Key.Original: If you find my van, please bring it back to the clinic.
Key.English: If you find my van, please bring it back to the clinic.

Key.Original: Sorry, sir, we're on a mission, we can't do that now.
Key.English: Sorry, sir, we're on a mission, we can't do that now.

Key.Original: Ah... Fine. I just hope there won't be any serious cases.
Key.English: Ah... Fine. I just hope there won't be any serious cases.

Key.Original: Dr. Hladik I presume? Sergeant Frost, 2 PARA. That's why we're here, sir.
Key.English: Dr. Hladik I presume? Sergeant Frost, 2 PARA. That's why we're here, sir.

Key.Original: Hello. Thanks for saving the village and the clinic.
Key.English: Hello. Thanks for saving the village and the clinic.

Key.Original: I have another problem, Sergeant. Guerillas stole our medical supply, can you get them back for me?
Key.English: I have another problem, Sergeant. Guerillas stole our medical supply, can you get them back for me?

Container.name: Hladik_topic1
Container.situation: thankful for getting supplies (player initiates topic)

Key.Original: You know, I was once in Prague. A beautiful city, plenty of fine pubs.
Key.English: You know, I was once in Prague. A beautiful city, plenty of fine pubs.

Key.Original: Hey now, I had at least four beers before getting ratted!
Key.English: Hey now, I had at least four beers before getting ratted!

Key.Original: One of those stag parties, right? Ah, you English don't know how to drink...
Key.English: One of those stag parties, right? Ah, you English don't know how to drink...

Key.Original: No worries, young man, I usually have fourteen...
Key.English: No worries, young man, I usually have fourteen...

Container.name: Hladik_topic2
Container.situation: thankful for getting supplies (player initiates topic)

Key.Original: What about the other doctor?
Key.English: What about the other doctor?

Key.Original: Oh, doctor Hrabec. Yes, the guerilla hunters had some wounded, so he went to help.
Key.English: Oh, doctor Hrabec. Yes, the guerilla hunters had some wounded, so he went to help.

Key.Original: That's what doctors do. Also, he likes hiking...
Key.English: That's what doctors do. Also, he likes hiking...

Key.Original: Indeed there are, we should probably lend them a hand.
Key.English: Indeed there are, we should probably lend them a hand.

Key.Original: And Stevo, It's just Czech now.
Key.English: And Stevo, It's just Czech now.

Key.Original: Nevermind.
Key.English: Nevermind.

Key.Original: 'Ey up, Frosty lad, there are some Czechoslovakian docs running the clinic right near the IED site.
Key.English: 'Ey up, Frosty lad, there are some Czechoslovakian docs running the clinic right near the IED site.

Key.Original: Check what, Frosty?
Key.English: Check what, Frosty?

Container.name: Killing_demoman

Key.Original: He's dead! Stevo, secure the IED site; disarm it, pronto.
Key.English: He's dead! Stevo, secure the IED site; disarm it, pronto.

Key.Original: Lancer Red to Lion: IED disarmed, triggerman KIA, zero casualties.
Key.English: Lancer Red to Lion: IED disarmed, triggerman KIA, zero casualties.

Key.Original: Roger that. Good job out there, Lancer Red. Go win some hearts and minds. Lion out.
Key.English: Roger that. Good job out there, Lancer Red. Go win some hearts and minds. Lion out.

Key.Original: I'm on it. ...that bastard could have took out the whole valley.
Key.English: I'm on it. ...that bastard could have took out the whole valley.

Key.Original: That were a piece of piss, lads. This place is safe...
Key.English: That were a piece of piss, lads. This place is safe...

Key.Original: By the by, there's the doc at the market, he wants to speak to you.
Key.English: By the by, there's the doc at the market, he wants to speak to you.

Key.Original: Alright. Lancers, I'll try to neutralise the triggerman. Everyone, take cover!
Key.English: Alright. Lancers, I'll try to neutralise the triggerman. Everyone, take cover!

Key.Original: Stop! Stop! You must no go!
Key.English: Stop! Stop! You must no go!

Key.Original: Bombs is in market. Bad man explodes when he see soldiers!
Key.English: Bombs is in market. Bad man explodes when he see soldiers!

Key.Original: He hide in house far. Go my house, he no sees you.
Key.English: He hide in house far. Go my house, he no sees you.

Key.Original: Shite! Frosty: you better flank that nutter; I can't do anything from here.
Key.English: Shite! Frosty: you better flank that nutter; I can't do anything from here.

Key.Original: Shit! Mortars incoming. Everyone, take cover!
Key.English: Shit! Mortars incoming. Everyone, take cover!

Key.Original: Hm, Frosty, I'd call it north, possibly north-east.
Key.English: Hm, Frosty, I'd call it north, possibly north-east.

Key.Original: Let's either move out or look for that bloody nutter. Your call, lad.
Key.English: Let's either move out or look for that bloody nutter. Your call, lad.

Container.name: Soliloquy
Container.situation: introductory soliloquy, sin city, apocalyspe now, max payne

Key.Original: Half the fun is in the getting there - that's what they say - we were just glad to be in one piece.
Key.English: Half the fun is in the getting there - that's what they say - we were just glad to be in one piece.

Key.Original: Operation Crimson Lance was imminent, and the lads were keen to get to it.
Key.English: Operation Crimson Lance was imminent, and the lads were keen to get to it.

Key.Original: The anticipation was tangible; it hummed feverishly in the dusty air.
Key.English: The anticipation was tangible; it hummed feverishly in the dusty air.

Key.Original: That day the lancers struck out into the wild, rolling expanse of Takistan...
Key.English: That day the lancers struck out into the wild, rolling expanse of Takistan...

Key.English: Lancer Red, copy, moving to objective. Out.

Key.Original: It's our time now, lads. Board the Jackals, we've got a long day ahead.
Key.English: It's our time now, lads. Board the Jackals, we've got a long day ahead.

Key.English: Lion to Lancer Red, Crimson Lance is a go; you can proceed. How copy?

Key.Original: Lancer Red successfully relocated to FOB Jester after preventing an IED setup in an inhabited area. Thanks to the dilligence of the section commander, Sgt. Brian Frost, the relationships with local tribesmen of Reegshur valley were improved significantly.
Key.English: Lancer Red successfully relocated to FOB Jester after preventing an IED setup in an inhabited area. Thanks to the dilligence of the section commander, Sgt. Brian Frost, the relationships with local tribesmen of Reegshur valley were improved significantly.

Key.English: MISSION FAILED

Key.English: MISSION FAILED

Key.English: All men of 1st Section/2/1Coy/2 PARA under the command of Sgt. Brian Frost have been killed in action.

Key.English: MISSION FAILED

Key.English: Sgt. Stephenson is dead. Without him, it's impossible to complete the mission.

Key.English: Report in FOB Jester

Key.English: FOB

Key.Original: UN guards of an NGO clinic report that there is an IED set up in Falar. Get to Falar, check the situation and report in.
Key.English: UN guards of an NGO clinic report that there is an IED set up in Falar. Get to Falar, check the situation and report in.

Key.Original: Check IED
Key.English: Check IED

Key.Original: IED
Key.English: IED

Key.Original:
19 July, late night:
Damnable country. If it's not the enemy that tries to top you, it's your own fucking side. These Americans are itchy on the trigger. We all are, I guess. Seeing anything to shoot beats just waiting for shriek of mortars from an unseen foe, or the sudden carnage of an IED taking more of our lads. The whole battle group is out for trouble in the mountains tomorrow. Still, at least we have these Jackals, brand new rides; finally, something we can trust.

20 July, morning:
We head in 15 minutes. Just got our FRAGO. Again, worst damn assignment in the whole platoon: IED patrol. I just hope we won't need Stephenson's skills...
Key.English:
19 July, late night:
Damnable country. If it's not the enemy that tries to top you, it's your own fucking side. These Americans are itchy on the trigger. We all are, I guess. Seeing anything to shoot beats just waiting for shriek of mortars from an unseen foe, or the sudden carnage of an IED taking more of our lads. The whole battle group is out for trouble in the mountains tomorrow. Still, at least we have these Jackals, brand new rides; finally, something we can trust.

20 July, morning:
We head in 15 minutes. Just got our FRAGO. Again, worst damn assignment in the whole platoon: IED patrol. I just hope we won't need Stephenson's skills...

Key.English: Support

Key.English:

Key.Original: Mission
Key.English: Mission

Key.Original:
Primary objectives:
- Check IED danger in Falar
- Reinforce FOB Jester

Execution:
- Lancer Red is to advance from the Assembly Area York to Falar and investigate the reported IED situation. The section will then proceed to FOB Jester at Jilavur through the Reegshur Valley in order to reinforce the FOB's garrison.
- Lancer Red is permitted to engage any targets of opportunity.
- The section's engineer must survive.
- Establishing and maintaining friendly relationships with the local populace is fundamental to success of this op.

Situation:
- OPFOR: Little or no insurgent activity is expected, although the danger of ambush or IED attack is probable. The section commander is advised to consult with local friendly sources and the UNFORT garrisons en route (base Whitewolf and OPs Hotel and Resource).
- There is an NGO-run medical clinic in Falar, protected by OP Hotel.
- Avoid engaging armed locals without prior IFF. Most armed locals belong to the Takistani Police Force or tribal paramilitary forces friendly to the new government.

NOTE: Avoid casualties: losses are not replaced during Operation Crimson Lance.
Key.English:
Primary objectives:
- Check IED danger in Falar
- Reinforce FOB Jester

Execution:
- Lancer Red is to advance from the Assembly Area York to Falar and investigate the reported IED situation. The section will then proceed to FOB Jester at Jilavur through the Reegshur Valley in order to reinforce the FOB's garrison.
- Lancer Red is permitted to engage any targets of opportunity.
- The section's engineer must survive.
- Establishing and maintaining friendly relationships with the local populace is fundamental to success of this op.

Situation:
- OPFOR: Little or no insurgent activity is expected, although the danger of ambush or IED attack is probable. The section commander is advised to consult with local friendly sources and the UNFORT garrisons en route (base Whitewolf and OPs Hotel and Resource).
- There is an NGO-run medical clinic in Falar, protected by OP Hotel.
- Avoid engaging armed locals without prior IFF. Most armed locals belong to the Takistani Police Force or tribal paramilitary forces friendly to the new government.

NOTE: Avoid casualties: losses are not replaced during Operation Crimson Lance.

Key.Original: Briefing
Key.English: Briefing

Key.Original: Elements of Lion battle group commenced operation Crimson Lance today at 0200 Zulu. The first phase of the operation counts on establishing forward operating bases and observation posts in the ridges surrounding the <marker name='valley'>Reegshur Valley</marker>. Mobile section- and platoon-sized teams will move in to reinforce the existing bases and establish new ones. Elements of 1 Coy ('Lancer') will advance to <marker name='feruz'>Feruz Abad</marker> and <marker name='garmarud'>Garmarud</marker>.
Key.English: Elements of Lion battle group commenced operation Crimson Lance today at 0200 Zulu. The first phase of the operation counts on establishing forward operating bases and observation posts in the ridges surrounding the <marker name='valley'>Reegshur Valley</marker>. Mobile section- and platoon-sized teams will move in to reinforce the existing bases and establish new ones. Elements of 1 Coy ('Lancer') will advance to <marker name='feruz'>Feruz Abad</marker> and <marker name='garmarud'>Garmarud</marker>.

Key.Original: Get to FOB Jester in Jilavur and report to Sgt. Sullivan, commander of the FOB.
Key.English: Get to FOB Jester in Jilavur and report to Sgt. Sullivan, commander of the FOB.

Key.Original: After your engineer clears the minefiled, give the tanks the 'clear' signal via radio 0-0-1.
Key.English: After your engineer clears the minefiled, give the tanks the 'clear' signal via radio 0-0-1.

Key.Original: Dr. Hladik mentioned that Rita Ensler, a well-known NGO worker, is currently assisting the local municipality of Feruz Abad. She could help you to earn the trust of the locals, and perhaps share some HUMINT.
Key.English: Dr. Hladik mentioned that Rita Ensler, a well-known NGO worker, is currently assisting the local municipality of Feruz Abad. She could help you to earn the trust of the locals, and perhaps share some HUMINT.

Key.English: ENSLER

Key.English: Support from Sakhe

Key.Original: Dr. Hladík will call his colleague Dr. Hrabec, who is with a Takistani Police Force group in the hills near Sakhe. He will certainly be able to talk round to active cooperation. We're not supposed to drag local paramilitary groups into our ops, but to hell with the regulations. They know the mountains, and their help may save our lives.
Key.English: Dr. Hladík will call his colleague Dr. Hrabec, who is with a Takistani Police Force group in the hills near Sakhe. He will certainly be able to talk round to active cooperation. We're not supposed to drag local paramilitary groups into our ops, but to hell with the regulations. They know the mountains, and their help may save our lives.

Key.English: After presenting Masood the package from Rita Ensler, Masood agreed to support us in case we would need to defend. I fear his fighters may be needed sooner that he expects.

Key.English: Commander? Sgt. Frost, 2 PARA. How are things in the eagle's nest?

Key.English: To není možný. Seržo, dyt vy vypadáte jak von!

Key.English: We just spot unknown footmobiles to the west. Once we even saw a group carrying a mortar!

Key.English: Fucking militias, we can't even fight them...

Key.English: Just checked the JOC Newsreader. Your TOC reports small footmobile groups on the move, spotted by a UAV.

Key.English: May be locals as well, hard to tell... I suggest to replenish the ammo here, just in case.

Key.English: 'Seems'? Wish to clarify that, Lancer Red?

Container.name: VG_pass
Container.situation: after vector green passed sucessfuly, radio chatter (mines disabled)

Key.Original: Hey, no problem Jimmy. My men drink, your men pay?
Key.English: Hey, no problem Jimmy. My men drink, your men pay?

Key.Original: Roger, Lancer Red out.
Key.English: Roger, Lancer Red out.

Key.Original: Cut the chitchat, boys. Lancer Red, good job, now return to primary, how copy?
Key.English: Cut the chitchat, boys. Lancer Red, good job, now return to primary, how copy?

Key.Original: Frosty, we're through. If you get your sorry arse in trouble, count on us!
Key.English: Frosty, we're through. If you get your sorry arse in trouble, count on us!

Container.name: VG_welcome
Container.participants: player (Sgt. Frost);Vector Green lead;Sgt. Philip Stephenson;
Container.situation: tanks in front of minefield, help arrives (near mines)

Key.Original: Stevo, you're up. Don't be shy, jump right in. Just try to be gentle, mate?
Key.English: Stevo, you're up. Don't be shy, jump right in. Just try to be gentle, mate?

Key.Original: You bet, Frosty, I always am. Uncle Phil's here now to take care of it.
Key.English: You bet, Frosty, I always am. Uncle Phil's here now to take care of it.

Key.Original: And here come the Lancers, lads! Glad to see you, Lancer Red.
Key.English: And here come the Lancers, lads! Glad to see you, Lancer Red.

Container.name: Whistling_onboard
Container.situation: just a idle chatter

Key.Original: Eh, Stevo?
Key.English: Eh, Stevo?

Key.Original: Hey, mate. Could you do me a favour?
Key.English: Hey, mate. Could you do me a favour?

Key.Original: Stop that bloody humming!
Key.English: Stop that bloody humming!

Key.Original: do, do, do do, do do, doo-doo do doo
Key.English: do, do, do do, do do, doo-doo do doo

Key.Original: doo do.. doo-do, doo-do, doo-do
Key.English: doo do.. doo-do, doo-do, doo-do

Key.Original: Speak and I shall thee obey, sir!
Key.English: Speak and I shall thee obey, sir!

Key.Original: Oh, er... Aye aye, sir.
Key.English: Oh, er... Aye aye, sir.

Container.name: Armour_Sakhe
Container.situation: more enemies incoming (enemy armour at sakhe)

Key.Original: Great, and what's the good news? Situation report, Lion
Key.English: Great, and what's the good news? Situation report, Lion

Key.Original: Lancer Red, be advised, there's hostile armour moving to Sakhe, 1... correction, 2 vehicles.
Key.English: Lancer Red, be advised, there's hostile armour moving to Sakhe, 1... correction, 2 vehicles.

Key.Original: It seems they are trying to encircle you; dispose immediate threat. Lion out.
Key.English: It seems they are trying to encircle you; dispose immediate threat. Lion out.

Container.name: Convoy_at_crossroads
Container.situation: task not done (convoy at xroads)

Key.Original: Bloody hell! Roger that, we'll do our very best, Lancer red out.
Key.English: Bloody hell! Roger that, we'll do our very best, Lancer red out.

Key.Original: Bad news, Lancer Red, enemy armour reached the crossroad at 036-056. They're establishing a perimeter.
Key.English: Bad news, Lancer Red, enemy armour reached the crossroad at 036-056. They're establishing a perimeter.

Key.Original: Lancer Black will try to break through, assist if possible. Lion out.
Key.English: Lancer Black will try to break through, assist if possible. Lion out.

Container.name: Convoy_destroyed
Container.situation: convoy destroyed

Key.Original: Glad to hear that, sir. Jester can start celebrating. Lancer Red out
Key.English: Glad to hear that, sir. Jester can start celebrating. Lancer Red out

Key.Original: No more worries about getting surrounded.
Key.English: No more worries about getting surrounded.

Key.Original: Lancer Red, the enemy column from Sakhe is in pieces. Over.
Key.English: Lancer Red, the enemy column from Sakhe is in pieces. Over.

Container.name: Convoy_destroyed_crossroads
Container.situation: convoy destroyed at xroads

Key.Original: Lion, that's just about the best news since we got to this hellhole!
Key.English: Lion, that's just about the best news since we got to this hellhole!

Key.Original: Lion to Jester and Lancers, the crossroad is clear of enemy forces.
Key.English: Lion to Jester and Lancers, the crossroad is clear of enemy forces.

Key.Original: Jester, be advised, we are sending Lancer Black to assist.
Key.English: Jester, be advised, we are sending Lancer Black to assist.

Container.name: Doyle_landed
Container.situation: reinforcements have arrived, radio

Key.Original: Jester, this is Doyle. Me and the boys just landed on Paddy - nice mess you have here! Over.
Key.English: Jester, this is Doyle. Me and the boys just landed on Paddy - nice mess you have here! Over.

Key.Original: Top job! Cleared to move in, Jester out.
Key.English: Top job! Cleared to move in, Jester out.

Container.name: Exeunt
Container.situation: exeunt soliloquy; sin city, apocalyspe now, max payne

Key.Original: The livid sky soared above us, the heat of the day burned out. The Lance lies broken in the desert sand.
Key.English: The livid sky soared above us, the heat of the day burned out. The Lance lies broken in the desert sand.

Key.Original: My lads look to me for answers; yet, the veil has slipped. I am a broken warrior with no sense of this world.
Key.English: My lads look to me for answers; yet, the veil has slipped. I am a broken warrior with no sense of this world.

Key.Original: These lads were built for war, not this. This isn't war - I don't know what this is.
Key.English: These lads were built for war, not this. This isn't war - I don't know what this is.

Key.Original: Soldiers became citizens; lads became men. Their eyes burn with questions, my eyes are heavy with regret...
Key.English: Soldiers became citizens; lads became men. Their eyes burn with questions, my eyes are heavy with regret...

Container.name: Fail
Container.situation: bad news (jester down)

Key.Original: Shit! Sure we'll try that. What happend to Jester? Over.
Key.English: Shit! Sure we'll try that. What happend to Jester? Over.

Key.Original: Roger that, Lion. Lancer Red out.
Key.English: Roger that, Lion. Lancer Red out.

Key.Original: Fuck, did we do our best?
Key.English: Fuck, did we do our best?

Key.Original: Lancer Red, be advised, FOB Jester has been overrun.
Key.English: Lancer Red, be advised, FOB Jester has been overrun.

Key.Original: Can you fight your way back to Whitewolf?
Key.English: Can you fight your way back to Whitewolf?

Key.Original: Knockout blow, we see no movement. Sorry, Frosty, prep for retreat, we need to regroup.
Key.English: Knockout blow, we see no movement. Sorry, Frosty, prep for retreat, we need to regroup.

Container.name: Jester_losses
Container.situation: heavy losses (less than 50% strength)

Key.Original: Copy that Jack, we do our best here. Can you hold for a little longer?
Key.English: Copy that Jack, we do our best here. Can you hold for a little longer?

Key.Original: Lancer Red, this is Jester. We're taking heavy losses! Jester's at a half strength!
Key.English: Lancer Red, this is Jester. We're taking heavy losses! Jester's at a half strength!

Key.Original: Frosty, I am losing my men here, mate! Jester out.
Key.English: Frosty, I am losing my men here, mate! Jester out.

Container.name: Mortars_out
Container.situation: task done, more to come

Key.Original: Lancer Red to Lion, mortar threat to FOB Jester neutralized. How copy?
Key.English: Lancer Red to Lion, mortar threat to FOB Jester neutralized. How copy?

Key.Original: Understood. Job well done, Lancer Red. Reinforcements en route. Sit tight. Lion out.
Key.English: Understood. Job well done, Lancer Red. Reinforcements en route. Sit tight. Lion out.

Container.name: OP_out
Container.situation: observation post destroyed

Key.Original: Copy that, Lion, glad to hear it.
Key.English: Copy that, Lion, glad to hear it.

Key.Original: Finally got that good news.
Key.English: Finally got that good news.

Key.Original: Pleased to hear it, Lion. Time to open the cage, Lancer Red out.
Key.English: Pleased to hear it, Lion. Time to open the cage, Lancer Red out.

Key.Original: Lancer Red, be advised, UAV passes show no more activity on the enemy OP. Over.
Key.English: Lancer Red, be advised, UAV passes show no more activity on the enemy OP. Over.

Key.Original: Lancer Red, good news is that the hostiles incoming from Shukurkalay seem to be struggling.
Key.English: Lancer Red, good news is that the hostiles incoming from Shukurkalay seem to be struggling.

Container.name: Paddy_secure
Container.situation: lz secured

Key.Original: Lion, LZ Paddy locked down! Do you copy?
Key.English: Lion, LZ Paddy locked down! Do you copy?

Key.Original: Cheers, Lion. My boys are the ones keeping us in the fight. Lancer Red out.
Key.English: Cheers, Lion. My boys are the ones keeping us in the fight. Lancer Red out.

Key.Original: Copy that. You're a heavyweight Frosty! Sending in Doyle's boys to your corner.
Key.English: Copy that. You're a heavyweight Frosty! Sending in Doyle's boys to your corner.

Container.name: Soliloquy
Container.situation: introductory soliloquy; sin city, apocalyspe now, max payne

Key.Original: It's the waiting that gets to the lads; it's the waiting that's the worst.
Key.English: It's the waiting that gets to the lads; it's the waiting that's the worst.

Key.Original: That sickly mixture of fear and vainglorious pride. The waiting.
Key.English: That sickly mixture of fear and vainglorious pride. The waiting.

Key.Original: My boys had tasted combat, striking out into the volatile sand and rock. They have no appetite for waiting.
Key.English: My boys had tasted combat, striking out into the volatile sand and rock. They have no appetite for waiting.

Key.Original: The hills had watched us, patiently; now the hills would reveal their terrible secrets, let forth their terrible rage...
Key.English: The hills had watched us, patiently; now the hills would reveal their terrible secrets, let forth their terrible rage...

Container.name: Starting_conversation
Container.situation: incoming enemy attack (mission start)

Key.Original: Everyone, grab your gear and get ready; it's kick off time.
Key.English: Everyone, grab your gear and get ready; it's kick off time.

Key.Original: Jester 1 to all Lancer Reds and Jesters. Multiple contacts incoming. Jester 1 out.
Key.English: Jester 1 to all Lancer Reds and Jesters. Multiple contacts incoming. Jester 1 out.

Key.Original: It's squeaky-bum time, lads...
Key.English: It's squeaky-bum time, lads...

Key.Original: Reinforcements
Key.English: Reinforcements

Key.Original: You can now use radio code 0-0-1 to fly reinforcements to this LZ.
Key.English: You can now use radio code 0-0-1 to fly reinforcements to this LZ.

Key.Original: The men of Lancer Red have repelled the attack on FOB Jester and defeated the enemy forces in Reegshur Valley, ensuring the positive outcome of the operation Crimson Lance. Their successful effort to bind the adversary main force has enabled the Pathfinders to locate the enemy's main camp - the next objective of the battle group. The men of the 2 PARA fought well today.
Key.English: The men of Lancer Red have repelled the attack on FOB Jester and defeated the enemy forces in Reegshur Valley, ensuring the positive outcome of the operation Crimson Lance. Their successful effort to bind the adversary main force has enabled the Pathfinders to locate the enemy's main camp - the next objective of the battle group. The men of the 2 PARA fought well today.

Key.Original: MISSION FAILED
Key.English: MISSION FAILED

Key.Original: All men of 1st Section/2/1Coy/2 PARA under the command of Sgt. Brian Frost have been killed in action.
Key.English: All men of 1st Section/2/1Coy/2 PARA under the command of Sgt. Brian Frost have been killed in action.

Key.Original: MISSION FAILED
Key.English: MISSION FAILED

Key.Original: FOB Jester was conquered by insurgent forces, who have subsequently exploited the breakthrough, seizing the whole Reegshur Valley and capturing the mountain tops around Feruz Abad. The key objectives of operation Crimson Lance are compromised, all remaining units will regroup and establish a defensive perimeter.
Key.English: FOB Jester was conquered by insurgent forces, who have subsequently exploited the breakthrough, seizing the whole Reegshur Valley and capturing the mountain tops around Feruz Abad. The key objectives of operation Crimson Lance are compromised, all remaining units will regroup and establish a defensive perimeter.

Key.Original: MISSION FAILED
Key.English: MISSION FAILED

Key.Original: Sgt. Brian Frost has been arrested by RMP on the charge of a serious infraction of the ROE. Detainee is now awaiting court-martial.
Key.English: Sgt. Brian Frost has been arrested by RMP on the charge of a serious infraction of the ROE. Detainee is now awaiting court-martial.

Key.Original: There's an enemy armored column advancing from the mountains S of <marker name = 'sakhe'>Sakhee</marker>, probably to cut FOB Jester off from the likely route of reinforcements. Even though Lancer Black (mechanized section) and possibly other units will try to destroy it, your assistance is requested.
Key.English: There's an enemy armored column advancing from the mountains S of <marker name = 'sakhe'>Sakhee</marker>, probably to cut FOB Jester off from the likely route of reinforcements. Even though Lancer Black (mechanized section) and possibly other units will try to destroy it, your assistance is requested.

Key.Original: Convoy
Key.English: Convoy

Key.Original: FOB Jester, Jilavur
Key.English: FOB Jester, Jilavur

Key.Original: COOP 10 Heat
Key.English: COOP 10 Heat

Key.Original: Personal notes
Key.English: Personal notes

Key.Original:
Primary objectives:
- Defend FOB Jester.
- Secure LZ Paddy for incoming reinforcements.

Execution:
- Lancer Red under the command of Sgt. Frost will engage any enemy threats to the base while TF Jester commanded by Sgt. Sullivan will defend the base perimeter.
- The insurgents are mounting several simultaneous threats to the base: ground attack by motorized formations, encircling manoeuvers by infantry, and sustained mortar fire. Neutralize them in any order that you feel appropriate. The enemy has also established an observation post: destroying it may cause confusion in enemy ranks.

Situation:
- OPFOR moved to contact, supposedly to cut off and eliminate FOB Jester. UAVs have identified two section- to platoon-sized motorized units incoming to Jilavur from the west, a mortar site, and several section-sized infantry groups to the west, north and south of the base, probably insurgent.
- BLUFOR is engaged by light enemy fire in Jilavur, Anar and Garmarud, but the advance of elements of TF Lion has not been delayed. An armoured reserve in Feruz Abad and Bastam move to the Reegshur Valley.
- Friendly or neutral paramilitary groups may be present in the area, and may engage the insurgents.
Key.English:
Primary objectives:
- Defend FOB Jester.
- Secure LZ Paddy for incoming reinforcements.

Execution:
- Lancer Red under the command of Sgt. Frost will engage any enemy threats to the base while TF Jester commanded by Sgt. Sullivan will defend the base perimeter.
- The insurgents are mounting several simultaneous threats to the base: ground attack by motorized formations, encircling manoeuvers by infantry, and sustained mortar fire. Neutralize them in any order that you feel appropriate. The enemy has also established an observation post: destroying it may cause confusion in enemy ranks.

Situation:
- OPFOR moved to contact, supposedly to cut off and eliminate FOB Jester. UAVs have identified two section- to platoon-sized motorized units incoming to Jilavur from the west, a mortar site, and several section-sized infantry groups to the west, north and south of the base, probably insurgent.
- BLUFOR is engaged by light enemy fire in Jilavur, Anar and Garmarud, but the advance of elements of TF Lion has not been delayed. An armoured reserve in Feruz Abad and Bastam move to the Reegshur Valley.
- Friendly or neutral paramilitary groups may be present in the area, and may engage the insurgents.

Key.Original: Briefing
Key.English: Briefing

Key.Original: Operation Crimson Lance ploughs on. British troops in the area reached their objectives by 1000 Z, have established strongpoints, and are advancing into the mountains. OPFOR put up minor resistance at <marker name = 'GurDur'>Mt. Gur Dur</marker>, but have attacked our <marker name = 'base'>western flank</marker> in attempt to besiege and destroy <marker name = 'base'>FOB Jester</marker>, thus exposing its positions and intent. TF Jester and a section of 1 Coy / 2 PARA are on their own until the mechanized reserve of 1st and 2nd Coy are deployed.
Key.English: Operation Crimson Lance ploughs on. British troops in the area reached their objectives by 1000 Z, have established strongpoints, and are advancing into the mountains. OPFOR put up minor resistance at <marker name = 'GurDur'>Mt. Gur Dur</marker>, but have attacked our <marker name = 'base'>western flank</marker> in attempt to besiege and destroy <marker name = 'base'>FOB Jester</marker>, thus exposing its positions and intent. TF Jester and a section of 1 Coy / 2 PARA are on their own until the mechanized reserve of 1st and 2nd Coy are deployed.

Key.Original: LZ Paddy is vital for bringing in reinforcements to FOB Jester and for further movements of our troops. Secure its vicinity including the adjacent farms.
Key.English: LZ Paddy is vital for bringing in reinforcements to FOB Jester and for further movements of our troops. Secure its vicinity including the adjacent farms.

Key.Original: Secure LZ Paddy
Key.English: Secure LZ Paddy

Key.Original: LZ PADDY
Key.English: LZ PADDY

Key.Original: Insurgents have an OP set up on a ridge west from Jilavur. Hitting their command and control will render a large part of the attacking force combat-ineffective.
Key.English: Insurgents have an OP set up on a ridge west from Jilavur. Hitting their command and control will render a large part of the attacking force combat-ineffective.

Key.Original: Observation Post
Key.English: Observation Post

Key.Original: OBSERVATION POST
Key.English: OBSERVATION POST

Key.Original: Enemy forces are moving towards FOB Jester. Build your defences and hold your ground. Our battle is lost should the base be seized by the insurgents.
Key.English: Enemy forces are moving towards FOB Jester. Build your defences and hold your ground. Our battle is lost should the base be seized by the insurgents.

Key.Original:
20 July, noon:

It looks like we've stumbled stright ino an ambush; certainly, the birds overhead seem pretty convinced of it. Cpt. Lewis is an old war dog - he knows what he's doing; he had just better send us something poste-haste. It's not like we're just sitting here with our heads up our arses - we are ready to give those bastards a nasty surprise. Utrinque Paratus.

Should this diary get to a friend or ally, please deliver it to a British military officer or embassy worker.

Ad Unum Omnes.
Key.English:
20 July, noon:

It looks like we've stumbled stright ino an ambush; certainly, the birds overhead seem pretty convinced of it. Cpt. Lewis is an old war dog - he knows what he's doing; he had just better send us something poste-haste. It's not like we're just sitting here with our heads up our arses - we are ready to give those bastards a nasty surprise. Utrinque Paratus.

Should this diary get to a friend or ally, please deliver it to a British military officer or embassy worker.

Ad Unum Omnes.

Key.Original: Defend FOB Jester
Key.English: Defend FOB Jester

Key.Original: DEFEND
Key.English: DEFEND

Key.Original: Support from locals
Key.English: Support from locals

Key.Original: Local fighters from Jilavur will attack incoming enemy forces to the west.
Key.English: Local fighters from Jilavur will attack incoming enemy forces to the west.

Key.Original: Support from locals
Key.English: Support from locals

Key.Original: TOC informed us that a Takistani Police Force group searching for insurgents diverted and is now guarding your rear in <marker name = 'sakhe'>Sakhe</marker>.
Key.English: TOC informed us that a Takistani Police Force group searching for insurgents diverted and is now guarding your rear in <marker name = 'sakhe'>Sakhe</marker>.

Key.Original: Support
Key.English: Support

Key.Original:
- Artillery support (limited)
- Ammunition Resupply Drop
- UAV (callsign Warmonger)

Reinforcements:
- Airborne section (TF Doyle) will insert by helicopter once LZ is secured.
- Mechanized column is advancing from Feruz Abad, ETA unknown.
Key.English:
- Artillery support (limited)
- Ammunition Resupply Drop
- UAV (callsign Warmonger)

Reinforcements:
- Airborne section (TF Doyle) will insert by helicopter once LZ is secured.
- Mechanized column is advancing from Feruz Abad, ETA unknown.

Key.Original: Mission
Key.English: Mission

Key.Original: Tanks - go
Key.English: Tanks - go

Key.Original: Regroup at LZ Paddy, wait for the transport chopper (Giant-5) and get ready to leave the AO for your new assignment.
Key.English: Regroup at LZ Paddy, wait for the transport chopper (Giant-5) and get ready to leave the AO for your new assignment.

Key.Original: Extraction
Key.English: Extraction

Key.Original: EXTRACTION
Key.English: EXTRACTION

Key.Original: FOB Jester is being shelled by mortars. Find them and neutralize the threat before it eliminates the whole Jester garrison. Eliminating the observation post will also make the shelling far less effective.
Key.English: FOB Jester is being shelled by mortars. Find them and neutralize the threat before it eliminates the whole Jester garrison. Eliminating the observation post will also make the shelling far less effective.

Key.Original: Mortars
Key.English: Mortars

Key.Original: MORTARS
Key.English: MORTARS

Key.Original: The enemy convoy secured the <marker name = 'xroads'>crossroad N of Sahkee</marker>. Assist in recapturing it to ensure the safe passage of the incoming reinforcements.
Key.English: The enemy convoy secured the <marker name = 'xroads'>crossroad N of Sahkee</marker>. Assist in recapturing it to ensure the safe passage of the incoming reinforcements.

Key.Original: Break the siege
Key.English: Break the siege

Key.Original: CROSSROADS
Key.English: CROSSROADS

Key.Original: 03: Heat
Key.English: 03: Heat

Key.Original: Fierce fight looms after tea time. Defend your base!
Key.English: Fierce fight looms after tea time. Defend your base!

Key.Original: OBSERVATION POST
Key.English: OBSERVATION POST

Key.Original: MORTARS
Key.English: MORTARS

Key.Original: LZ PADDY
Key.English: LZ PADDY

Key.Original: The insurgents are attemping to encircle FOB Jester. The battle of Reegshur Valley has just begun.
Key.English: The insurgents are attemping to encircle FOB Jester. The battle of Reegshur Valley has just begun.

Container.name: UAV_Sakhe
Container.situation: robotic speech, radio, static (armoured attacked by ind)

Key.Original: Finally some good news. Who's attacking them? Over.
Key.English: Finally some good news. Who's attacking them? Over.

Key.Original: Ah, looks like our help paid off. Great job, lads.
Key.English: Ah, looks like our help paid off. Great job, lads.

Key.Original: Lion to Lancer Red, the enemy's taking fire in Sakhe.
Key.English: Lion to Lancer Red, the enemy's taking fire in Sakhe.

Key.Original: Most probably some local heros beating the shit out of them, guerilla-style. Godspeed, Lion out.
Key.English: Most probably some local heros beating the shit out of them, guerilla-style. Godspeed, Lion out.

Container.name: Victory
Container.situation: task done (chopper)

Key.Original: Roger, we're on it. What's the situation, Lion?
Key.English: Roger, we're on it. What's the situation, Lion?

Key.Original: Bloody hell, that's some good news! What's the catch, Lion? Over.
Key.English: Bloody hell, that's some good news! What's the catch, Lion? Over.

Key.Original: Hey, lads, great work. Command says we've knocked them out!
Key.English: Hey, lads, great work. Command says we've knocked them out!

Key.Original: But the fight's not over. We've got to prep for round two: the insurgent base is waiting.
Key.English: But the fight's not over. We've got to prep for round two: the insurgent base is waiting.

Key.Original: Lancer Red, this is Lion. Be advised, regroup and move to LZ Paddy. How copy?
Key.English: Lancer Red, this is Lion. Be advised, regroup and move to LZ Paddy. How copy?

Key.Original: Your boys just won us The Battle of Reegshur Valley, Lancer Red.
Key.English: Your boys just won us The Battle of Reegshur Valley, Lancer Red.

Key.Original: It's not over yet. Typhoon just identified the enemy assembly area.
Key.English: It's not over yet. Typhoon just identified the enemy assembly area.

Key.Original: We'll strike after dusk. You're assigned to take part. Lion out.
Key.English: We'll strike after dusk. You're assigned to take part. Lion out.

Container.name: Wave_1_out
Container.situation: first wave destroyed

Key.Original: Damn straight. These lads showed 'em what they're made of.
Key.English: Damn straight. These lads showed 'em what they're made of.

Key.Original: Lancer Red and Jester, excellent work. UAV shows you beat back the initial wave. Over.
Key.English: Lancer Red and Jester, excellent work. UAV shows you beat back the initial wave. Over.

Key.Original: Lancer Red, keep a cool head. More insurgents are inbound, but we are getting you those reinforcements. Lion out.
Key.English: Lancer Red, keep a cool head. More insurgents are inbound, but we are getting you those reinforcements. Lion out.

Container.name: Clyde_in
Container.situation: main attack, request of support (clyde launched)

Key.Original: Lancer Red to Lion, TF Clyde is free to go. Over.
Key.English: Lancer Red to Lion, TF Clyde is free to go. Over.

Key.Original: Copy that, Lancer Red, Clyde advancing. Hope you neutrilised those defenses. Lion out.
Key.English: Copy that, Lancer Red, Clyde advancing. Hope you neutrilised those defenses. Lion out.

Container.name: Clyde_out
Container.situation: main attack, heavy losses (clyde withdrawal)

Key.Original: Hell's teeth... It better just be a faulty radio.
Key.English: Hell's teeth... It better just be a faulty radio.

Key.Original: Lion to all, be advised, Clyde dropped off the network. Help them if you can. Lion out.
Key.English: Lion to all, be advised, Clyde dropped off the network. Help them if you can. Lion out.

Container.name: Exeunt
Container.situation: exeunt soliloquy; sin city, apocalyspe now, max payne

Key.Original: The livid sky soared above us, the heat of the day burned out.
Key.English: The livid sky soared above us, the heat of the day burned out.

Key.Original: The Lance drips crimson rain onto the scorched dirt. The blood pools and collects, an oasis in the desert sand.
Key.English: The Lance drips crimson rain onto the scorched dirt. The blood pools and collects, an oasis in the desert sand.

Key.Original: Aye, an oasis - life will spawn from this quickened pool. Lads give their lives so others might live, might grown, might flourish.
Key.English: Aye, an oasis - life will spawn from this quickened pool. Lads give their lives so others might live, might grown, might flourish.

Key.Original: We've done something here, aye; we stand upon the threshold of revelation...
Key.English: We've done something here, aye; we stand upon the threshold of revelation...

Container.name: Fail
Container.situation: bad news (all kia)

Key.Original: Lion, do you read me? Lancer Red, my lads are down ... my lads are down, Lion.
Key.English: Lion, do you read me? Lancer Red, my lads are down ... my lads are down, Lion.

Key.Original: Roger that, Lion. Lancer.. Lancer Red out.
Key.English: Roger that, Lion. Lancer.. Lancer Red out.

Key.Original: Lancer Red, stay where you are and evade contacts if necessary!
Key.English: Lancer Red, stay where you are and evade contacts if necessary!

Key.Original: Be on standby, we will raise you when the battle's over.
Key.English: Be on standby, we will raise you when the battle's over.

Container.name: G5_landing
Container.situation: g5 landing, shiver, recognition

Key.Original: Am I dreaming?
Key.English: Am I dreaming?

Key.Original: Typhoon Blue, Lancer Red. Is that you, Tanny?
Key.English: Typhoon Blue, Lancer Red. Is that you, Tanny?

Key.Original: Landing imminent, lads. Strobes in sight.
Key.English: Landing imminent, lads. Strobes in sight.

Container.name: Soliloquy

Key.Original: Hell. I know what hell tastes like. Salt, silicon, cordite. Victory is sweet - that's what they say - whoever they are.
Key.English: Hell. I know what hell tastes like. Salt, silicon, cordite. Victory is sweet - that's what they say - whoever they are.

Key.Original: Victory isn't sweet; victory is the absence of the taste of fear and the stench of death.
Key.English: Victory isn't sweet; victory is the absence of the taste of fear and the stench of death.

Key.Original: These hills are stained with the still and silent presence of both.
Key.English: These hills are stained with the still and silent presence of both.

Key.English: In sharp counterpoint, the crescendo of our operation approached, my lads could sense it...

Key.English: Ach no, it's great tae see yeh, bud.

Key.Original:
The outstanding performance of the Coalition task force in the final attack has lead to the complete victory over the last insurgent armed formation in the mountains of Sarman Ghar. The success of operation Crimson Lance will surely lead to the successful conclusion of the NATO counter-insurgency campaign in Takistan.

The performance of Lancer Red in this final step of the operation was outstanding.

Congratulations.
Key.English:
The outstanding performance of the Coalition task force in the final attack has lead to the complete victory over the last insurgent armed formation in the mountains of Sarman Ghar. The success of operation Crimson Lance will surely lead to the successful conclusion of the NATO counter-insurgency campaign in Takistan.

The performance of Lancer Red in this final step of the operation was outstanding.

Congratulations.

Key.Original:
The final attack has lead to the victory over the last insurgent armed formation in the mountains of Sarman Ghar, even though the Allied task force involved in operation Crimson Lance has sustained the significant losses. The success of operation Crimson Lance will surely lead to the successful conclusion of the NATO counter-insurgency campaign in Takistan.

The performance of Lancer Red in this final step of the operation was admirable.

Well done.
Key.English:
The final attack has lead to the victory over the last insurgent armed formation in the mountains of Sarman Ghar, even though the Allied task force involved in operation Crimson Lance has sustained the significant losses. The success of operation Crimson Lance will surely lead to the successful conclusion of the NATO counter-insurgency campaign in Takistan.

The performance of Lancer Red in this final step of the operation was admirable.

Well done.

Key.Original:
The final strike against the insurgent stronghold has failed; Coalition units were forced to break off due to heavy casualties caused by the fortified defences of the enemy. The course of battle is under investigation.

The likelihood of the NATO task force successfully continuing operation Crimson Lance has been put at risk.
Key.English:
The final strike against the insurgent stronghold has failed; Coalition units were forced to break off due to heavy casualties caused by the fortified defences of the enemy. The course of battle is under investigation.

The likelihood of the NATO task force successfully continuing operation Crimson Lance has been put at risk.

Key.Original:
20 July, afternoon, LZ Paddy:
The shit storm passed over our heads, and we live to die another day. My lads have experienced proper action now - the kind where days later you can still taste the dust and hear the crack of bullets flying past your head while your sitting on the shitter or kipping in your wank chariot. Aye, these toms did alright, and now we're advancing into the hills. These fucking hills might just be the end of me.
Key.English:
20 July, afternoon, LZ Paddy:
The shit storm passed over our heads, and we live to die another day. My lads have experienced proper action now - the kind where days later you can still taste the dust and hear the crack of bullets flying past your head while your sitting on the shitter or kipping in your wank chariot. Aye, these toms did alright, and now we're advancing into the hills. These fucking hills might just be the end of me.

Key.Original: Mission
Key.English: Mission

Key.Original:
Primary objectives:
- Secure point Keystone overlooking objective Zulu
- Attack the enemy defences from long range
- Seize objective Zulu together with TFs Clyde, Tribal and Warhorse

Execution:
- Lancer Red will be inserted by helicopter at LZ Fortuna, secured by pathfinders (callsign 'Typhoon'). The section commander is advised to equip at the ammunition shipment prepared at the LZ.
- The section will covertly move to point Keystone and eliminate any targets of opportunity.
- After reaching Keystone, Lancer Red is to seek and engage any heavy weapon platforms inside Zulu's perimeter: armored, anti-air artillery and MANPADS, anti-armor missile systems, and field howitzers.
- Lancer Red 1 is authorized to relay attack signals to air support, callsign (Warhorse), and ground attack task-forces: callsigns 'Lancer', 'Clyde' and 'Tribal'.
- Once the majority of enemy forces are neutralized, Lancer Red will move in to secure the base perimeter together with the ground attack troops.

Situation:
- OPFOR troops are now gathered in the camp area of objective Zulu. The base perimeter is guarded by infantry patrols circling the outer perimeter and by the three strongpoints: Keystone, Luton, and Mayfair. The enemy is armed with static field howitzers, missile systems, HMGs and recoilles. UAV readout indicates several battle-ready vehicles, probably Soviet-made tanks, APCs and Shilka SPAAG.
- BLUFOR troops have regrouped in order to encircle the base camp. Elements of TF Lion seized Anar and the western outskirts of the objective, TF Tribal (US Army) will advance through a pass near Timurkalay.
- Mountain patrols of Takistani Police Force may assist in capturing the outer defences of the objective. Avoid engaging friendly paramilitary forces!
Key.English:
Primary objectives:
- Secure point Keystone overlooking objective Zulu
- Attack the enemy defences from long range

Execution:

- Once the majority of enemy forces are neutralized, Lancer Red will move in to secure the base perimeter together with the ground attack troops.

Situation:
- OPFOR troops are now gathered in the camp area of objective Zulu. The base perimeter is guarded by infantry patrols circling the outer perimeter and by the three strongpoints: Keystone, Luton, and Mayfair. The enemy is armed with static field howitzers, missile systems, HMGs and recoilles. UAV readout indicates several battle-ready vehicles, probably Soviet-made tanks, APCs and Shilka SPAAG.
- BLUFOR troops have regrouped in order to encircle the base camp. Elements of TF Lion seized Anar and the western outskirts of the objective, TF Tribal (US Army) will advance through a pass near Timurkalay.
- Mountain patrols of Takistani Police Force may assist in capturing the outer defences of the objective. Avoid engaging friendly paramilitary forces!

Key.Original: Briefing
Key.English: Briefing

Key.Original: After successfully repelling the attack on our western flank and seizing the key hilltops and settlements in the AO, pathfinders of TF Lion have located a large assembly area SE of <marker name = 'anar'>Anar</marker> (now designated <marker name = 'base'>objective Zulu</marker>). The encampment is fortified by several strongpoints, and is teeming with regrouping insurgent armor and infantry. Elements of TF Lion will exploit recent tactical gains to destroy the enemy mainforce before it can regroup and counter-attack.
Key.English: After successfully repelling the attack on our western flank and seizing the key hilltops and settlements in the AO, pathfinders of TF Lion have located a large assembly area SE of <marker name = 'anar'>Anar</marker> (now designated <marker name = 'base'>objective Zulu</marker>). The encampment is fortified by several strongpoints, and is teeming with regrouping insurgent armor and infantry. Elements of TF Lion will exploit recent tactical gains to destroy the enemy mainforce before it can regroup and counter-attack.

Key.Original: Deploy all long-range weapons and reinforcements to weaken the defences of <marker name = 'base'>objective Zulu</marker>. Use all available supports. Call in the gunships (<marker name = 'reinfstart2'>Warhorse</marker>) and ground elements (<marker name = 'reinfstart3'>Lancer</marker>, <marker name = 'reinfstart3'>Clyde</marker> and <marker name = 'reinfstart1'>Tribal</marker>) as you see fit, but avoid sending them in front of AA or AT defences respectively.
Key.English: Deploy all long-range weapons and reinforcements to weaken the defences of <marker name = 'base'>objective Zulu</marker>. Use all available supports. Call in the gunships (<marker name = 'reinfstart2'>Warhorse</marker>) and ground elements (<marker name = 'reinfstart3'>Lancer</marker>, <marker name = 'reinfstart3'>Clyde</marker> and <marker name = 'reinfstart1'>Tribal</marker>) as you see fit, but avoid sending them in front of AA or AT defences respectively.

Key.Original: Mission
Key.English: Mission

Key.Original:
Primary objective:
- Conquer the enemy military base.
- Avoid casualties.

Execution
- The Commanding Element will observe the base, calling in available support (artillery, CAS) and command armour and infantry in the attack.
- Two Warriors and an infantry section are prepared to strike the base. They will advance on the command of the Raven BG CO, attack the base perimeter and neutralize the defences.
- An artillery battery is available in the vicinity. It will fire upon Raven's request.

Situation
- The Takistani Army regiment residing N of Zargabad moved to Rasman during the night in order to deploy against the US Task Force Knight. The objective (OPFOR base) is guarded by a platoon-sized infantry garrison and several infantry vehicles (Shilka SPAAG).
- Infantry sentries are patrolling the base perimeter, but will not leave the base's immediate vicinity. The vehicles are most likely combat-ready.
- BLUFOR: Raven BG attacked the rear of a Takistani regiment. US Army Task Force Knight is closing in on Zargabad from the south.
Key.English:
Primary objective:
- Conquer the enemy military base.
- Avoid casualties.

Execution
- The Commanding Element will observe the base, calling in available support (artillery, CAS) and command armour and infantry in the attack.
- Two Warriors and an infantry section are prepared to strike the base. They will advance on the command of the Raven BG CO, attack the base perimeter and neutralize the defences.
- An artillery battery is available in the vicinity. It will fire upon Raven's request.

Situation
