- Infantry sentries are patrolling the base perimeter, but will not leave the base's immediate vicinity. The vehicles are most likely combat-ready.
- BLUFOR: Raven BG attacked the rear of a Takistani regiment. US Army Task Force Knight is closing in on Zargabad from the south.

Key.Original: Briefing
Key.English: Briefing

Key.Original: The Takistani Army <marker name='baseArea'>base</marker> north of Zargabad has almost emptied over past few hours: most of its garrison has been moved south. NATO command have assigned a small British battle group, Raven, to assault the weakened garrison. Under the cover of darkness, an <marker name = 'startInf'>infantry section</marker> and <marker name = 'startTanks'>Warriors</marker> have moved into position and are ready to attack the base. You, in command of TF Raven, are tasked with coordinating this assault, and getting our boys back home safely.
Key.English: The Takistani Army <marker name='baseArea'>base</marker> north of Zargabad has almost emptied over past few hours: most of its garrison has been moved south. NATO command have assigned a small British battle group, Raven, to assault the weakened garrison. Under the cover of darkness, an <marker name = 'startInf'>infantry section</marker> and <marker name = 'startTanks'>Warriors</marker> have moved into position and are ready to attack the base. You, in command of TF Raven, are tasked with coordinating this assault, and getting our boys back home safely.

Key.Original: The battle will end in the event of severe casualties of BG Raven. Avoid sending your troops against a stronger enemy.
Key.English: The battle will end in the event of severe casualties of BG Raven. Avoid sending your troops against a stronger enemy.

Key.Original: Briefing
Key.English: Briefing

Key.Original:
- Oil fields of Karzeghistan have been overrun by Takistan's elite army batallions. One of The Agency's regional contacts has produced a report detailing Takistani rocket artillery activity in the area.
- The file is hidden under the seat of a rusty old GAZ car belonging to his cousin. This cousin had parked the vehicle at one of several locations; yet, he was shot dead by a Takistani patrol when leaving Shapur.
- Black Element has been offered a fortune by The Agency to retrieve this file.

Key.Original: SEIZE
Key.English: SEIZE

Key.Original:
- The Takistani Army has crossed into Karzeghistan's disputed borderlands and seized a refinery complex in Shapur, along with an airstrip and military base.
- A large United Nations convoy - full of vital supplies - was stationed in the base at the time of the raid, and has been captured by Takistani forces.
- Royal Lancers are tasked to assault the Shapur base and recover the UN vehicles and their precious cargo, before the small Takistani garrison complete their plans to move it north into the wilds of Takistan.

- The Takistani Army has crossed into Karzeghistan's disputed borderlands and seized a refinery complex in Shapur, along with an airstrip and military base.

Key.Original: Mission
Key.English: Mission

Key.Original:
Primary objectives:
- Secure the military base in Shapur.
- UN vehicles in the base must survive.

Execution
- Mechanized force reconnaisance team will assault the base from the east.

Situation
- The Takistani Army is holding the military base, your objective.
- It is likely that there are small groups patrolling, equipped by shoulder-launched AT weapons.
- Unconfirmed reports place enemy armour in the vicinity; estimated as platoon-sized formations of T-72 or T-55 MBTs.
- An unknown number of aircraft of any kind may be present on the airstrip.
- Civilians were forced to evacuate; no civilian population is present in the AO.
Key.English:
Primary objectives:

Key.Original: TRANSPORT
Key.English: TRANSPORT

Key.Original:
Primary objective:
- Transport troops on the battlefield according to the requests of TOC.

Execution
- Giant-5 (1 Merlin HC3) will be prepared to take-off at immediate notice from FOB Arizona.
- Three combat troop transport tasks will be requested by the TOC ('Lion').
- On TOC's notice, Giant-5 will return to base.
- Giant-5 is to avoid the enemy fire as much as possible.

Situation
- BLUFOR ground troops reconnoiter, block and contain the insurgent forces and strategic points in the mountains.
- OPFOR presence is low, yet there are many small and disparate groups scattered across the mountains: scouting, ambushing, installing explosive traps, and covertly infiltrating TF Lion's AOR.
- Insurgent MANPADS-equipped AA teams will attempt to disrupt the air troop transport and defend themselves from our air strikes - there could be some of these groups atop nearby mountain ranges.

Key.Original: Mission
Key.English: Mission

Key.Original:
Primary objectives:
- Secure objective Yankee (crossroad in Garmarud)
- Secure objective X-Ray (farm E of Garmarud)

Execution
- 1st Sec/1st Plt ('Raider Red'), divided into teams Alpha (infantry), Mike (LMG support), Sierra (sniper support) and Juliet (Jackal 2 MWMIK) advance along the road to Garmsar and engage any targets of opportunity.
- Alpha will advance to Yankee, and then secure X-ray with assistance of the supporting elements.
- Mike will advance on elevated terrain and provide covering fire to the N.
- Sierra will engage any targets in and around Garmarud. Once Yankee is captured, team will overwatch the AO.
- Juliet will advance along Alpha and support it with the mounted HMG.

Situation
- Platoon-sized insurgent group are dug in tight at both objectives at the moment. Some of its elements will likely be patrolling the surroundings.
- Section-sized garrison is holding farms (objective X-Ray).
- The OPFOR patrols may be moving to the OA from multiple directions once the combat commences. Team commanders should avoid being flanked by the enemy.
- No civilian populace is present in the area.
Key.English:
Primary objectives:
- Secure objective Yankee (crossroad in Garmarud)
- Secure objective X-Ray (farm E of Garmarud)

Execution
- 1st Sec/1st Plt ('Raider Red'), divided into teams Alpha (infantry), Mike (LMG support), Sierra (sniper support) and Juliet (Jackal 2 MWMIK) advance along the road to Garmsar and engage any targets of opportunity.
- Alpha will advance to Yankee, and then secure X-ray with assistance of the supporting elements.
- Mike will advance on elevated terrain and provide covering fire to the N.
- Sierra will engage any targets in and around Garmarud. Once Yankee is captured, team will overwatch the AO.
- Juliet will advance along Alpha and support it with the mounted HMG.

Situation
- Platoon-sized insurgent group are dug in tight at both objectives at the moment. Some of its elements will likely be patrolling the surroundings.
- Section-sized garrison is holding farms (objective X-Ray).
- The OPFOR patrols may be moving to the OA from multiple directions once the combat commences. Team commanders should avoid being flanked by the enemy.
- No civilian populace is present in the area.

Key.Original: Briefing
Key.English: Briefing

Key.Original: Operation Crimson Lance commenced this morning. 1st Platoon, callsing 'Raider', has been ordered to advance towards the town of <marker name='garmsar'>Garmsar</marker>. However, the crossroad in <marker name='opfor'>Garmarud</marker>, leading to <marker name='garmsar'>Garmsar</marker> and to <marker name='narandarre'>Naran Darre</marker> pass, is held by an insurgent paramilitary force. The task to secure Garmarud has been assigned to 'Raider Red' section.

Key.Original: SCUD
Key.English: SCUD

Key.Original:
Primary objective:
- Destroy the Scud launcher before it launches the missile
- Eliminate the rocket artillery unit

Execution
- Golf-3 will covertly move into position overlooking the launch site and attack enemy using its anti-materiel rifles.
- All OPFOR units in the vicinity need to be eliminated.
- Upon eliminating all hostiles, Golf-3 will withdraw to exfiltration point Echo and stand by for a new assignment.

Situation
- A Takistani missile launch site has been discovered only minutes ago in its highest state of readiness.
- According to UAV imagery, the mobile launcher is closing in, and will proceed to launch less than a minute upon arriving to the site.
- Golf-3 is only Allied unit in vicinity.

Key.Original: Briefing
Key.English: Briefing

Key.Original: In the days immediately following the invasion, British SAS troops were inserted into the Takistani desert to hunt for mobile Scud launchers. Patrol Golf-3 has been ordered to execute a hasty attack on a nearby mobile launcher which was spared by the Coalition air strikes, and is currently preparing to launch its deadly cargo. The site must be destroyed.

Patrol Golf-3 has been ordered to execute a hasty attack on a nearby mobile launcher which was spared by the Coalition air strikes, and is currently preparing to launch its deadly cargo. The site must be destroyed.

Key.Original: KILO
Key.English: KILO

Key.Original:
Primary objectives:
- Search points Kilo, Mike and Oscar for IED caches
- Destroy any discovered IED caches
- Neutralize OPFOR threats and troops on objectives

Execution:
- Raider Red will advance to Kilo and Mike to inspect them and report back.
- Burner-1 will provide cover on Raider Red's right flank.
- After checking points K and M, Raider Red should board Burner-1 and get transported near Oscar.
- Raider Red, with support from Burner-1, will advance to the objective Oscar, seize it and check for IEDs.
- Any IED caches found will be destroyed imemdiately, using the captured ordnance.

Situation:
- BLUFOR patrols of TF Lion are currently patrolling the areas under the direct control of former Republican Militia insurgents.
- Insurgents are highly mobile and will attempt to attack the BLUFOR patrols on opportunity, and protect their facilities against our patrols. The AO is probably well protected by paramilitary groups with light AT weapons.
- The AO is suspected to be a source of IED supply: Kilo and Mike are probably transition locations, the farm designated Oscar may be either larger warehouse or even a manufacture facility. Striking at the IED production facility would relieve the BLUFOR troops around Rasman.
Key.English:
Primary objectives:
- Search points Kilo, Mike and Oscar for IED caches
- Destroy any discovered IED caches
- Neutralize OPFOR threats and troops on objectives

Execution:
- Raider Red will advance to Kilo and Mike to inspect them and report back.
- Burner-1 will provide cover on Raider Red's right flank.
- After checking points K and M, Raider Red should board Burner-1 and get transported near Oscar.
- Raider Red, with support from Burner-1, will advance to the objective Oscar, seize it and check for IEDs.
- Any IED caches found will be destroyed imemdiately, using the captured ordnance.

Situation:
- BLUFOR patrols of TF Lion are currently patrolling the areas under the direct control of former Republican Militia insurgents.
- Insurgents are highly mobile and will attempt to attack the BLUFOR patrols on opportunity, and protect their facilities against our patrols. The AO is probably well protected by paramilitary groups with light AT weapons.
- The AO is suspected to be a source of IED supply: Kilo and Mike are probably transition locations, the farm designated Oscar may be either larger warehouse or even a manufacture facility. Striking at the IED production facility would relieve the BLUFOR troops around Rasman.

Key.Original: Briefing
Key.English: Briefing

Key.Original:
- IEDs are becoming more and more pervasive, and the insurgents own the land. British troops, currently tasked with securing the vicinity of the bases, are prime targets of insurgent attacks.
- Your infantry team (Raider Red), supported by a Warrior AFV (Burner-1), will cooperate in the search for IED stashes. There are 3 places in the desert S of Zavarak, where intel has indicated the possible existance of IED storage and manufacture sites (objectives Oscar, Kilo and Mike). It is likely that such a facility will be well guarded by the insurgent forces, but TOC still has no UAVs in the air to confirm, and the support capacities of FOB Arizona are, currently, scarce.
Key.English:

It is likely that such a facility will be well guarded by the insurgent forces, but TOC still has no UAVs in the air to confirm, and the support capacities of FOB Arizona are, currently, scarce.

Key.Original:
Welcome, soldier! In this base, you may find the all vehicles and weapons of the British Armed Forces contingent in Takistan.

You are free to try the ground vehicles, helicopters and personal weapons.

There are two shooting ranges available: the shooting range for personal and static weapons and the heavy weapons range, where you can practice with anti-tank launchers or vehicles.

Activate a task to get pointed to particular location.

The failure of this operation has been probably caused by the failure of Unicorn-6 to destroy the enemy armour before the attack of TF Lynx.

Key.Original: Mission
Key.English: Mission

Key.Original:
Primary objective:
- Destroy all enemy armour in Azizayt
- Secure camp at Azizayt

Execution
- Tankhunter team, 'Unicorn-6', will commence the attack on enemy armour at the camp at 0530 Zulu from its position.
- Once the armour is eliminated, Unicorn-6 will report and call in TF Lynx.
- TF Lynx is ready to strike the objective on notice and eliminate remaining infantry.
- Unicorn-6 is tasked to assist TF Lynx by flanking the camp's defences, using the hilly terrain for cover.

Situation
- OFPOR: A mechanized company is stationed in Azizayt. Composition: 2 MBTs, 1 SPAAG, an unknown number of soft vehicles (possibly armed) and 1 infantry section.
- The majority of Zargabad is under Allied control; however, OPFOR reinforcements can be expected from the W and SW.
Key.English:
Primary objective:
- Destroy all enemy armour in Azizayt
- Secure camp at Azizayt

Execution
- Tankhunter team, 'Unicorn-6', will commence the attack on enemy armour at the camp at 0530 Zulu from its position.
- Once the armour is eliminated, Unicorn-6 will report and call in TF Lynx.
- TF Lynx is ready to strike the objective on notice and eliminate remaining infantry.
- Unicorn-6 is tasked to assist TF Lynx by flanking the camp's defences, using the hilly terrain for cover.

Situation
- OFPOR: A mechanized company is stationed in Azizayt. Composition: 2 MBTs, 1 SPAAG, an unknown number of soft vehicles (possibly armed) and 1 infantry section.
- The majority of Zargabad is under Allied control; however, OPFOR reinforcements can be expected from the W and SW.

Key.Original: Briefing
Key.English: Briefing

Key.Original:
- Operation Arrowhead was successful, but what has followed constitutues a brief but dangerous period of instability. NATO face the threat of armed groups of unknown origins and with unclear intentions - most of them composed of former Republican Militias and Guard regiments of the Takistani Army. British troops in the Zargabad area launched operation 'Serpent Root' against these small but heavily armed hostile groups.
- One of these groups is dug in at a former police training camp in Azizayt. Tankhunter detachment Unicorn-6 will attack enemy armour before the attack of mechanized TF Lynx; both sections will secure the area afterwards.
Key.English:
- Operation Arrowhead was successful, but what has followed constitutues a brief but dangerous period of instability. NATO face the threat of armed groups of unknown origins and with unclear intentions - most of them composed of former Republican Militias and Guard regiments of the Takistani Army. British troops in the Zargabad area launched operation 'Serpent Root' against these small but heavily armed hostile groups.
- One of these groups is dug in at a former police training camp in Azizayt. Tankhunter detachment Unicorn-6 will attack enemy armour before the attack of mechanized TF Lynx; both sections will secure the area afterwards.

Key.Original: The enemy has sent a mechanized section to reinforce the garrison at Azizayt. Neutralize them in order to finish the mission.

Key.Original: Sweep Shukurkalay
Key.English: Sweep Shukurkalay

Key.Original: SWEEP
Key.English: SWEEP

Key.Original:
Primary objectives:
- Insert QRT ground element at point Avalon
- Provide overhead cover and CAS
- Extract QRT ground element at point Bedivere

Execution:
- Phantom-1 will take off from LZ Paddy immediately after QRT ground element 'Doyle Black' boards.
- 'Doyle Black' will be inserted at point Avalon, join Bravo-3 patrol and sweep Shukurkalay.
- QRT elements ('Phantom-1','Doyle Black') are permitted to engage any targets in and around the vicinity of the town.
- Phantom-1 will provide close air support as necessary.
- Upon completion of the sweep manoeuver, Phantom-1 will extract 'Doyle Black' from Bedivere and return to LZ Paddy.
- Jester TOC is responsible for the sweep coordination.

Situation
- Patrol Bravo-3 spotted a team-sized paramilitary foot patrol in Shukurkalay.
- BLUFOR: There are BLUFOR units inbound: airborne QRT 'Doyle Black', armoured recon section 'Burner-1' (Warrior AFV). Currently unable to establish UAV coverage.
- OPFOR: A small footmobile unit in downtown Shukurkalay. The likelihood of several section-sized hostile groups trying to encapsulate and destroy Bravo-3 is high.
- Civilians may be present in the AO.
Key.English:
Primary objectives:
- Insert QRT ground element at point Avalon
- Provide overhead cover and CAS
- Extract QRT ground element at point Bedivere

Execution:
- Phantom-1 will take off from LZ Paddy immediately after QRT ground element 'Doyle Black' boards.
- 'Doyle Black' will be inserted at point Avalon, join Bravo-3 patrol and sweep Shukurkalay.
- QRT elements ('Phantom-1','Doyle Black') are permitted to engage any targets in and around the vicinity of the town.
- Phantom-1 will provide close air support as necessary.
- Upon completion of the sweep manoeuver, Phantom-1 will extract 'Doyle Black' from Bedivere and return to LZ Paddy.
- Jester TOC is responsible for the sweep coordination.

Situation
- Patrol Bravo-3 spotted a team-sized paramilitary foot patrol in Shukurkalay.
- BLUFOR: There are BLUFOR units inbound: airborne QRT 'Doyle Black', armoured recon section 'Burner-1' (Warrior AFV). Currently unable to establish UAV coverage.
- OPFOR: A small footmobile unit in downtown Shukurkalay. The likelihood of several section-sized hostile groups trying to encapsulate and destroy Bravo-3 is high.
- Civilians may be present in the AO.

Key.Original: Briefing
Key.English: Briefing

Key.Original:
- A few days after hitting the insurgants hard in the Reegshur Valley, British troops of Lion BG are patrolling the mountain areas in order to protect the locals and enable further humanitarian efforts. FOB Jester in Jilavur has become one of the main counter-insurgency assets, providing a safe haven to Paras patrolling the dangerous surroundings of Shukurkalay.
- Only minutes ago, Bravo-3 patrol reported multiple contacts in a suddenly silent town. A Quick Reaction Team aboard a Wildcat helicopter, prepared on LZ Paddy, has been sent to investigate the situation.
Key.English:
- A few days after hitting the insurgants hard in the Reegshur Valley, British troops of Lion BG are patrolling the mountain areas in order to protect the locals and enable further humanitarian efforts. FOB Jester in Jilavur has become one of the main counter-insurgency assets, providing a safe haven to Paras patrolling the dangerous surroundings of Shukurkalay.
- Only minutes ago, Bravo-3 patrol reported multiple contacts in a suddenly silent town. A Quick Reaction Team aboard a Wildcat helicopter, prepared on LZ Paddy, has been sent to investigate the situation.
